STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 30, 2025
Tishara Price
MACOMB COUNTY DHHS
44777 N Gratiot Ave,
Clinton Township, MI, 48036-1362
Re: License #: CP500201269
SI #: 2025SIC0000439
Dear Tishara Price:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT

Services

Clinton Township, MI 48036-1362
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/20/2026

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on
Code & central registry.
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During a sibling visit on 2/26/25, a foster care worker choked a
foster youth while they were supervising the visit. There were no
resulting injuries.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Section Manager was interviewed utilizing video conferencing on
3/11/2025. Section Manager reported Foster Care Worker 2 has
been a foster care worker for several years and currently has a
workload that is split between foster care and a special project.
The foster care portion of his job does not include direct case
management currently, rather he assists other case managers as
needed. On 3/3/2025 Section Manager was contacted by Foster
Care Worker 2’s supervisor, Foster Care Supervisor, to report
Youth A had parenting time and a sibling visit on 2/26/2025 that
was supervised by Foster Care Worker 2. On 2/27/2025, Youth
A’s relative placement, Caregiver A, reached out to Youth A’s
assigned worker, Foster Care Worker 1, to inform her Youth A
alleged Foster Care Worker 2 had choked her during the sibling
visit. Section Manager was told Foster Care Worker 1 asked
Foster Care Worker 2 about the 2/26/2025 visit on 2/27/2025 and
interviewed the children about the allegation on 2/28/2025. On
3/3/2025 Foster Care Worker 1 met with Foster Care Supervisor
and told her what was reported to her by the youths. Section
Manager stated she is not aware of any performance issues with
Foster Care Worker 2.
Foster Care Worker 1 was interviewed utilizing video
conferencing on 3/11/2025. She reported she has been assigned
Youth A and Youth A’s 6 siblings’ cases since they came into care
in December 2024. Foster Care Worker 1 stated she had to be off
work early on 2/26/2025, so Foster Care Worker 2 supervised the
scheduled parenting time and sibling visit for Youth A. Foster Care
2

Worker 1 stated this is the first time Foster Care Worker 2
supervised any visits for this family. On 2/27/2025, Foster Care
Worker 1 received a call from Caregiver A who reported Youth A
told her Foster Care Worker 2 has choked her during the sibling
visit the previous evening. Caregiver A stated Youth A described
the choke as two hands around her neck. On 2/28/2025, Foster
Care Worker 1 spoke to Youth A who told her Foster Care Worker
2 had only touched her on the back of the neck, which made her
uncomfortable. She said it occurred during the end of the sibling
visit when it was time to clean up. She stated Foster Care Worker
2 was trying to get her attention because she wasn’t cleaning up.
She did not state Foster Care Worker 2 put two hands around her
neck or that he choked her. Foster Care Worker 1 also spoke with
Youth A’s 4 youngest siblings, all of whom reported Youth A was
choked by Foster Care Worker 2; however, they all stated they did
not see Foster Care Worker 2 touch Youth A.
Foster Care Worker 2 was interviewed utilizing video
conferencing on 3/11/2025. He stated Foster Care Worker 1 had
something else going on 2/26/2025 so he was asked to supervise
a parenting time and sibling visit for her. He reported this was his
first time supervising this family. He reported he supervised
parenting time between Parent A and his 5 children from 4:00-
5:00pm at the agency office. After that visit, those children’s two
older siblings came to the agency office for a sibling visit. Foster
Care Worker 2 stated one of the older siblings left the visit after 10
or 15 minutes due to being frustrated with the behavior of the
younger children. Foster Care Worker 2 stated he was watching
the visit through one -way glass and would enter the room if he
had to intervene with the youths’ behavior. He stated he entered
the room toward the end of the visit to prompt the younger
children to help their older sibling clean up the room. He stated he
heard from Foster Care Worker 1 the following day that Youth A
alleged Foster Care Worker 2 choked her during the visit. Foster
Care Worker 2 stated he never choked Youth A or any other
youth. He stated when he walked through the door at the end of
the visit, one of the youths was right behind the door, so he might
have put a hand on that youth’s shoulder to let the youth know he
was right there. He did not recall which youth was behind the
door. He stated it was possible he put a hand one of the youths
when prompting them to help clean up, but he never choked
anyone, nor did he ever place two hands on any of them.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed utilizing video
conferencing on 3/12/2025. She reported being the supervisor to
Foster Care Worker 1 and Foster Care Worker 2. Foster Care
3

Supervisor asked Foster Care Worker 2 to supervise the parenting
time and sibling visits for Foster Care Worker 1 as the visit was to
take place after hours and Foster Care Worker 2 will work after
hours. The visit was to start with Parent A and his 5 children from
4:00-5:00pm. A sibling visit was to take place with all 7 siblings
from 5:00-6:00pm. Foster Care Supervisor reported Foster Care
Worker 1 received a phone call from Youth A on 2/27/2025
reporting that Foster Care Worker 2 choked her during the sibling
visit. Foster Care Supervisor reported she was off work the
following day. Foster Care Worker 1 told Foster Care Supervisor
the following Monday that she had pulled the youths into the
agency office to ask them about the choking allegations and that
Youth A said Foster Care Worker 2 had only placed his hand on
the back of her neck. Foster Care Worker 1 stated Foster Care
Worker 2 told her the visit was very hectic, as it usually is, and
when it was time to clean up at the end of the visit the youths were
out of control. Foster Care Supervisor stated this is not the first
allegation made by Caregiver 1, Youth A’s caregiver.
Detective was interviewed by phone on 3/11/2025. Detective
reported having made initial contact with agency staff and was
planning to set up forensic interviews with all 7 youths at a local
children’s advocacy center. He reported he would follow up with
the date and time so I could attend. On 3/19/2025 I received an
email from Detective stating he consulted with the prosecutor and
the advocacy center, and it was determined to be a conflict of
interest for Division of Child Welfare Licensing to sit in on or watch
the interviews.
Caregiver A was interviewed by phone on 4/15/2025. She stated
she was informed by Foster Care Worker 1 a few weeks ago that
Foster Care Worker 2 would be supervising a visit for her as she
was unable. After that visit, Youth A told Caregiver A Foster Care
Worker 2 was behind her and grabbed her by the back of the
neck, squeezing, and her saying something about Youth A acting
up. Caregiver A stated she believed all of the other youths in her
care saw this happen. She stated, to her knowledge, Foster Care
Worker 2 has had no further contact with any of the youths.
Youth A was interviewed by phone on 4/15/2025. She indicated
she remembered the visit supervised by Foster Care Worker 2.
She stated she was looking into the two-way mirror then Foster
Care Worker 2 came into the visit room. Youth A reported Foster
Care Worker 2 put his hand on the back of her neck causing her
to say, “get your hand from around my neck” to which Foster Care
Worker 2 responded “what, I’m just putting my hands around your
4

neck.” She stated her neck started to hurt a little bit. When asked
if he did anything with his hand, she replied he “squeezed a little.”
She stated Foster Care Worker 2 then left the room.
Youth B was interviewed by phone on 4/15/2025. She indicated
she remembered the visit supervised by Foster Care Worker 2
and remembered Foster Care Worker 2 checking on them during
the visit. She stated she did not see anything happen between
Youth A and Foster Care Worker 2.
Youth C was interviewed by phone on 4/15/2025. She indicated
she remembered the visit supervised by Foster Care Worker 2.
She stated, during that visit, Youth A got choked by Foster Care
Worker 2. She stated she saw him with his hands on the back of
her neck. She did not hear Youth A say anything.
Youth D was interviewed by phone on 4/15/2025. He indicated
she remembered the visit supervised by Foster Care Worker 2. He
stated, during that visit, he saw Foster Care Worker 2 put his
hands on Youth A’s neck from behind her. He heard Youth A state
“get your hands off my neck.”
Youth E was interviewed by phone on 4/15/2025. He indicated
she remembered the visit supervised by Foster Care Worker 2. He
stated Youth A told him Foster Care Worker 2 choked her, but he
didn’t see it happen.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
5/16/2025 email from Detective stating criminal charges against
Foster Care Worker 2 were not authorized by the county
prosecutor. Police report was requested but not received.
Analysis A violation of Foster Care Worker 2 failing to demonstrate suitable
character and ability to meet the needs of children is not
established as Youth A reported Foster Care Worker 2 placed his
hand on the back of her neck as opposed to the allegation, he
placed two hands around her neck and choked her.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12214
Section • (1) An agency shall comply with the child protection law,
Description 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
5

Allegation Agency staff did not immediately report alleged abuse of a foster
child.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Section Manager was interviewed utilizing video conferencing on
3/11/2025. Section Manager reported she was contacted by
Foster Care Worker 2’s supervisor, Foster Care Supervisor, to
report Youth A had parenting time and a sibling visit on 2/26/2025
that was supervisor by Foster Care Worker 2. On 2/27/25, Youth
A’s relative placement, Caregiver A, reached out to Youth A’s
assigned worker, Foster Care Worker 1, to inform her that Youth A
alleged that Foster Care Worker 2 had choked her during the
sibling visit. Section Manager was told that Foster Care Worker 1
asked Foster Care Worker 2 about the visit on 2/27/2025 and
interviewed the children about the allegation on 2/28/2025. On
3/3/2025 Foster Care Worker 1 met with Foster Care Supervisor
and told her what was reported to her by the youths. Section
Manager stated once she was notified of the allegations by Foster
Care Supervisor, she had Foster Care Supervisor report the
allegations.
Foster Care Worker 1 was interviewed utilizing video
conferencing on 3/11/2025. She reported she that on 2/27/2025,
Foster Care Worker 1 received a call from Caregiver A who
reported Youth A told her Foster Care Worker 2 choked her during
the sibling visit the previous evening. Caregiver A stated Youth A
described the choke as two hands around her neck. On
2/28/2025, Foster Care Worker 1 spoke to Youth A who told her
Foster Care Worker 2 had only touched her on the back of the
neck, which made her uncomfortable. Foster Care Worker 1 also
spoke with Youth A’s 6 siblings who all stated they did not see
Foster Care Worker 2 touch Youth A.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed utilizing video
conferencing on 3/12/2025. She reported being the supervisor to
Foster Care Worker 1 and Foster Care Worker 2. Foster Care
Supervisor reported Foster Care Worker 1 received a phone call
from Youth A on 2/26/2025 reporting that Foster Care Worker 2
choked her during the sibling visit. Foster Care Supervisor
reported she was off work the following day. Foster Care Worker 1
told Foster Care Supervisor the following Monday that she had
pulled the youths into the agency office to ask them about the
choking allegations. Foster Care Supervisor reported telling
Section Manager about the choking allegation after which Section
Manager told Foster Care Supervisor to report the allegations.
Foster Care Supervisor stated the protocol is to reach out to
Section Manager before filing any formal complaint allegation.
6

DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
MDHHS Policy APR 200 which states the following:
The Child Protection Law requires that a department employee
who is one of the following and has reasonable cause to
suspect child abuse or neglect must make a report of
suspected child abuse or neglect to the department:
• Social services specialist.
• Social work specialist.
• Social work specialist manager.
An individual who is a mandated reporter and has reasonable
cause to suspect child abuse or neglect must immediately make
a report of suspected child abuse or neglect
MDHHS Policy FOM 722-13
Foster care caseworkers and supervisors must immediately
report suspected child abuse and/or neglect to Centralized
Intake (CI).
Analysis A violation is established as neither Foster Care Worker 1 nor
Foster Care Supervisor reported Youth A’s allegation of being
choked by Foster Care Worker 2 immediately, as required. In this
case, the alleged abuse was not reported for 7 days during which
time Foster Care Worker interviewed the youths involved about
the allegation.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
May 30, 2025
______________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 30, 2025
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
